Then the King will say to those on his right, "Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.

    "For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in, I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me."

    Then the righteous will answer him, "Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink? When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you? When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?"

    The King will reply, "I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me."

    Matthew 25: 34-40

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: My mother herself was given a chance to rise out of poverty. While she made it, so many others haven't and I still witness it in my travels. Now, with the blessings that I have here in the developed world, I wish to help give that chance to others.

lenders.name: Patrick
lenders.loan_because: I don't have a good reason.  Why not?

lenders.name: Gil - West Hills, CA
lenders.occupational_info: I run a small construction company in Los Angeles, California USA.  We do remodeling projects, room additions in both residential and commercial areas.  I very much enjoy the construction process.  It is such a great feeling to start a project as well as seeing the final results when the job is completed.

lenders.name: Alison
lenders.loan_because: the world is bigger than i am

lenders.name: Rennie
lenders.loan_because: I think it helps.
lenders.occupational_info: A college student from Nepal, studying in the US.

lenders.name: Ed!
lenders.loan_because: I feel like I'm one of the lucky people who benefits greatly from the labors of developing countries by living in a developed nation.  I want to give back so people in other nations who don't have it as easy as I did can achieve their dreams, too.

lenders.name: Joseph & Julie
lenders.loan_because: we were able to start our business due to a loan from a successful businessman.
lenders.occupational_info: We design environmentally and human friendly buildings:  personal sustainable design.

lenders.name: Chuck
lenders.loan_because: my sister gave us gift certificates for Christmas and this is a direct way to help other much less advantaged that us.
lenders.occupational_info: I provide psychological services (psychotherapy and psychological assessments) in a private practice setting.

lenders.name: Just2Turtles
lenders.loan_because: We, in the US, don't have a clue about real poverty. A mere $25 dollars can buy incredible opportunity for someone struggling to survive in the third world.

lenders.name: Christopher & Ella Blue
lenders.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I support school teachers and students with their technology and communication needs.

lenders.name: Sami
lenders.loan_because: In order to take one must first give.
lenders.occupational_info: Artistic advertising.

lenders.name: Lindsay
lenders.loan_because: I believe in supporting people who have a strong work ethic and want to improve their lives.  I don't believe in giving a hand out, but I think that giving someone a hand up is a moral obligation we all have as human beings.  No one succeeds on their own.

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: It's good karma.
lenders.occupational_info: I LOVE to knit and would like to make my living off it. By lending to people with knitting/fabric businesses maybe I can make that dream come true for others...

lenders.name: Derek
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of a "hand up", rather than a "hand out".  Others have helped me, so in a small way, maybe I can help others.

lenders.name: Jim & Mary
lenders.loan_because: Giving a hand up to help someone be successful feels great!

lenders.name: My Linh
lenders.loan_because: why not?

lenders.name: Dafnie
lenders.loan_because: I am of Haitian descent so my family comes from poverty. I also am a young, Christian woman who loves helping others! I am in school studying finance so Kiva has definitely grabbed my attention because it combines my interest in helping third world countries and in finance. I love how I can help someone with just one click of a button.

lenders.name: Bo and Michael!
lenders.loan_because: money is only worth anything if it is making lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: Michael is a professor and I am the program manager of a University Honors Program...we are both temporary beings hoping to leave this world with good work and little impact from our use....

lenders.name: John Hering
lenders.loan_because: the only way to predict the future is to invent it.

lenders.name: Erik
lenders.loan_because: To give others the sense of financial security and ultimately independence.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: I have been abundantly blessed and wish to bless others.

lenders.name: Nigel
lenders.loan_because: I believe in empowering people to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: Asset Management

lenders.name: Mary Anna
lenders.loan_because: We are only a drop of water alone, but together we are a ocean!!!!
lenders.occupational_info: I think that my work has been great!

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: through hard work and perseverance ANYTHING is possible.
lenders.occupational_info: I help deliver medical treatments to patients all over the world who suffer from immunological diseases.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: we are all global citizens and responsible for each others peace and well-being.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with teachers in a high school helping them use reading and writing strategies in all content areas, not just English classes.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: Everyone should do what they can to help others.

lenders.name: Linda A
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to contribute to a change for people and the world.
lenders.occupational_info: My job is to promote health and prevent disease in children and adolescents.

lenders.name: Wendy
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to help someone else make their dreams happen.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a stay at home foster mom.

lenders.name: Byron
lenders.loan_because: Everybody deserves a chance.
lenders.occupational_info: My company manufactures the best insulation in the world.

lenders.name: Tod & Carrie
lenders.loan_because: Microfinance really helps!
lenders.occupational_info: Carrie manages the corporate taxes for a large US clothing retailer.  Tod is a homemaker and cares for our children.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: it's good to pass it on.

lenders.name: Phillip
lenders.loan_because: being rich in spirit should be our ultimate goal.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for social justice.

lenders.name: ash
lenders.loan_because: if capitalization ends poverty; it's criminal not to.
lenders.occupational_info: computer networks, programming, electronics manufacturing and robotics.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Student.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I look for opportunity to share some of the wealth that God has given me in this life.
